problem: A regular hexagon is reflected across one of its diagonals across opposite vertices. How many of the original vertices match with their reflected image?
solution: In a regular hexagon, a diagonal across opposite vertices divides the hexagon into two equal trapezoids and is a line of symmetry. When the hexagon is reflected across this diagonal, the vertices on the diagonal line (the ends of the diagonal) remain unchanged. Thus, 2 vertices out of the 6 vertices match with their reflected image. \(\boxed{2}\)
